newsitem.title: INDIA: India's SEBI sets up panel for futures and options.
newsitem.headline: India's SEBI sets up panel for futures and options.

text.p: Market regulator the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has appointed a committee to recommend regulations for index-based options and futures trading, the Press Trust of India said on Tuesday.

The news agency quoted SEBI Chairman D.R. Mehta as saying the market watchdog had urged the government to issue a notification to overcome a legal hurdle posed by the Indian Contracts Act for the introduction of options and futures.
Mehta was speaking at the concluding session session of a two-day meeting with foreign investors and other capital market participants.
He said SEBI was working on getting legal clearances and preparing regulations to introduce futures and options.
Mehta said the committee had been asked to submit its recommendations in three months but could seek an extension of the deadline.
